intro: Ceraia aurantiiflammea, commonly known as the flame orange ceraia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant orange-red flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy surface. The flowers are clustered in terminal inflorescences and are known for their showy, tubular shape.
